metadata.name: LSASS Process Memory Dump Creation Via Taskmgr.EXE
metadata.comment: Detects the creation of an "lsass.dmp" file by the taskmgr process. This indicates a manual dumping of the LSASS.exe process memory using Windows Task Manager.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM file_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 3 AND (endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower(':\\\\windows\\\\system32\\\\taskmgr.exe')) OR endswith(lower(actor.process.name), lower(':\\\\windows\\\\syswow64\\\\taskmgr.exe'))) AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\\\appdata\\\\local\\\\temp\\\\')) AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('\\\\lsass')) AND contains(lower(file.path), lower('.dmp')))

output.summary: Detects the creation of an "lsass.dmp" file by the taskmgr process. This indicates a manual dumping of the LSASS.exe process memory using Windows Task Manager.

metadata.objective: False positive: Rare case of troubleshooting by an administrator or support that has to be investigated regardless Reference: https://github.com/redcanaryco/atomic-red-team/blob/987e3ca988ae3cff4b9f6e388c139c05bf44bbb8/atomics/T1003.001/T1003.001.md#L1
